alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 10:04AM EST until December 15 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch. Sleet may also mix in. * WHERE...North-central Maryland, portions of northern Virginia, and Jefferson County in West Virginia. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the morning commute on Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wintry precipitation begins overnight and continues through Thursday morning. Warmer air should push in from southeast to northwest Thursday afternoon gradually changing the precipitation to rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
